TopicTitle: I found Jeb Kerman's Junkyard And Spaceship Factory IRL

Articles.Content:
Tucked away in the corner of an unassuming industrial estate in my hometown.

Maybe I should ask them for a tour?
That logo on a flag...
Haha! Good work.

Nice...

KSP has changed my minnnndddd!
Done.

Done.

Not to put down your hard work, but it really needs the word "Kerman" for proper brand recognition.

Their website: http://www.kerman.com.au/

Their slogan is "Setting The Highest Standard in Design And Construction". Not sure how that applies to re-purposing old water heaters as rocket fuel tanks though.

Well, they have a website: http://www.kerman.com.au/

I... do not think they suspect they they'll be getting a bit of free marketing from this game.

(Edit: Agh, ninja'd. GG, mate! )
Awesome I'm sure their admin is scratching his head now, and wondering what caused sudden surge of visitors on website.
I'm emailing them for three NTRs and some FL-45 fuel tanks

Hahaha, this is hillarious

Anyone called yet and asked for a nuclear engine?

I'm emailing them for three NTRs and some FL-45 fuel tanks

Just be sure to post the response here!
Oh my word they have been busy...

Oh my word they have been busy...

I'm guessing promo catchphrase is "Moving Western Australia to China since 1981"
im going to email them and ask for a mk.1-2 command pod.

Awesome I'm sure their admin is scratching his head now, and wondering what caused sudden surge of visitors on website.

And their lawyers are sharpening their knives in anticipation of a trademark infringement suit.......

I would really, really recommend contacting this company and asking for permission to use their logo. They might like the publicity and the idea of their flag flying on imaginary planets. But OTOH, they might think KSP epic rocket fails give them a bad name.

Just be sure to post the response here!

Yeah, guys, don't prank them. They'll have no clue what you're talking about.
See if you can't find me a cupola command pod

I just realized that it's actually run by the three Kerman brothers, Chris Kerman, Gary Kerman and Michael Kerman,Just like the original commanders, Jeb, Bill and Bob.

Key contacts

Chris Kerman

Managing Director

Gary Kerman

Human Resources Manager

Michael Kerman

Safety & Quality Manager
Am I the only one finding it hilarious that in the OP photo, the trash can lid obscures the sign so that it says "Stop! Strictly no entry into safety"?
God, this is hilarious.

And their lawyers are sharpening their knives in anticipation of a trademark infringement suit.......

They're an Australian company, not American...

Very nice!

Not to be creepy but I want to try to see how good I am at deduction and use only the information in the photograph to take a guess at its locale . . . (realize someone linked to their website up above but will try to guess without that) . . . Based on the architecture and spacing between bulidings I'm going with North America, probably U.S. but that plant life does look a bit 'stunted' so northern latitude (_possibly_ Canada) . . . hmmm, the fact that the large structure has one wall that is completely open suggests that this MIGHT be a temperate climate where the winters are not very harsh (depends on what the large structure is used for I guess). If this were a more southern locale like Georgia then the 'stunted tree' on the right could actually be an overgrown shrub and the basic arrangement of stuff does remind me rather much of places I've seen around Atlanta . . . I'm gonna guess southern U.S. probably east of the Mississippi (if I was more of a botanist I could probably place it better).

ADDIT:

Well, they have a website: http://www.kerman.com.au/

I... do not think they suspect they they'll be getting a bit of free marketing from this game.

Oh wow! Holy crap I was way off!!
